activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark E Smith

defendant.name: Smith, Mark E
defendant.address: 11700 N. Mosquito Brook Road, Hayward, WI 54893

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

10:00 AM Defendant Mark E Smith not in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Mark E Smith.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. This covers cases 21CF152 & 22CF119.  Attorney Sutton relates and puts agreement on the record.  DA O'Boyle relates this plea agreement was reached between DA Wright and Attorney Sutton, and he is not willing to follow their agreement to DRI case 22CF119 as the allegations state DE spit on corrections officer, and he feels the agreement is inappropriate. Attorney Sutton relates she will reschedule when DA Wright can be present. Court relates.  Case to be reset.

11:28 AM Defendant Mark E Smith appears by Zoom video, in custody at the Barron County Jail.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appears by Zoom video. for Mark E Smith.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 21CF152 (COMPETENCY HEARING), AND 22CF119 (AIA).

21CF152 - Attorney Sutton relates she went over the report with Defendant.  State relates.  Court relates and finds that the Defendant is competent to proceed and is able to assist in his Defense.  Attorney Sutton relates she only represents Defendant on 21CF152 and requests a plea hearing.  Court asks Attorney Sutton if she will take appointment for 22CF119.  Attorney Sutton relates and believes Defendant may qualify for public defender.  

22CF119 -  Court relates and appoints Attorney Sutton (as public defender appointed) to this file also.  Attorney Sutton relates.

Court sets Plea/Status hearings before Judge Bitney for both files for 10/21/22 @ 10:00 a.m.

SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL
Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Adjourned initial appearance on August 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
NOH sent to Def at the Barron Co Jail

11:30 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark E Smith not in court (appears late, in custody, by zoom video)  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Mark E Smith. 

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 21CF152 AND 22CF119

11:31  Court relates and gives appearances.
11:31  Atty. Sutton relates she has requested a competency evaluation in 21CF152; Atty. Sutton represents defendant only in 21CF152.
11:33  Court questions Atty. Sutton.  Atty. Sutton requests an order be granted
Court finds there is good reason to order competency evaluation in 21CF152, in addition to the evaluation that was done in Sawyer County.
Court orders evaluation as requested.
Wisconsin forensic unit may utilize prior evaluation that was done for Sawyer County.
Either they come here to do in person or he will need to be transported.
11:40  Defendant appears late by zoom video from Barron Co Jail.
11:41  Court questions Mr. Smith and informs defendant regarding the evaluation.
Hearing date for 22CF119 to track with hearing date in 21CF152.

(MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on July 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
NOH sent to Def at Barron Co Jail

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark E Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Mark E Smith for today.
Public Defender's office has not appointed counsel.  Court relates.  Court adjourns and sets next hearing  before Judge Bitney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark E Smith not in court, in custody.  Jailer advises Defendant is refusing to appear for court.
Court relates and resets to Friday.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Status Report
and order - Denying as Defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:13 AM Defendant Mark E Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steuer appears by zoom video for today only and Attorney Dustin Rockow for today only.
Attorney Steuer relates Defendant did not qualify for public defender in April.  Jail Staff to give blue form.  Case to be recalled. 10:28 a.m. back on the record.  Blue form presented from the jail.  Court relates on no assets or income and puts Defendant in a breakout room with Attorney Dustin Rockow.  Case to be recalled again. 10;37 a.m. back on the record and Defendant qualifies for public defender.  AIA set and signature bond continued.


SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark E Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Mark E Smith.  Address confirmed and phone number updated.   Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.  Defendant relates he would like to represent himself.  Court will address issue at next court hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
